category: Herbs That Clear Heat and Purge Fire

action.primary: Dispels Wind-Dampness, soothes the sinews and unblocks the channels

indications: Adjunctively for hot abdominal pain, early periods Excess bleeding and mastitis

action.primary: Relieves abdominal pain due to inflammation
Clears Damp-Heat from the Lower Jiao

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with diarrhea due to Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.
Contraindicated for those with sores due to Qi Deficiency.
Contraindicated for those with Yin ulcers.

useCases: Wind-Heat throughout the body affecting the channels and collaterals with stiffness and pain.
Early periods due to Blood Heat.
Excessive bleeding due to Blood Heat.

notes: This herb is called “the stem that resists winter”.
It is primarily used to treat abscesses and sores and Wind-Damp-Heat-Bi.
This herb may substitute for Flos Lonicerae Japonica #{JinYinHua} Jin Yin Hua.
Its actions are focused on the channels.
It unblocks channels and collaterals to stop pain – for Wind-Heat Bi.
The dry vine is not as rapid in its effect as the fresh.

Both Ren Dong Teng and Flos Lonicerae #{JinYinHua} Jin Yin Hua clear Heat and resolve toxicity. Ren Dong Teng is not as strong, but it can expel Wind-Heat from the channels and collaterals to stop pain which Jin Yin Hua cannot do. Ren Dong Teng is therefore useful for Wind-Damp-Heat Bi and for abscesses and sores.

Both Ren Dong Teng and Caulis Sargentodoxae #{HongTeng} Hong Teng resolve toxicity, reduce sores, clear Heat, and treat Bi Syndrome and abdominal pain. Ren Dong Teng clears Wind-Heat from the collaterals to stop pain while Hong Teng resolves toxicity, invigorates Blood, stops pain and treats breast and abdominal abscesses.
